notDistrTitle.message: Is not the information spreading organizer

notDistrDesc.message: Services from the ISO (information spreading organizers) registry may automatically transmit your personal data, including messages and all traffic, to government authorities. This service is not in the ISO registry.

distrDesc.message: The Service may transfer your personal data, including messages and all traffic to government authorities automatically.

distrCoopRefused.message: The service claimed that they do not transmit traffic to government agencies automatically.

blockedDesc.message: Access to the site is banned, but Censor Tracker gives you access to it through a reliable proxy.

notBlockedDesc.message: If access to the site is banned, then Censor Tracker will offer to open the site through a reliable proxy.

controlledByOtherExtensionsMessage.message: Another extension controls the proxy. More detailed →

privateBrowsingPermissionsRequiredMessag.message: Proxy disabled. Private windows browsing permissions required →

ignoredSitesDesc.message: Addresses that will always be ignored by the Censor Tracker. It can help if there are problems with opening the site. Each address starts with a new line.

ignoreAutosaveTip.message: Changes are automatically saved when clicked Enter or Backspace.

optionsProxyDesc.message: If the site is blocked, the Censor Tracker will grant access to it. Disable this setting if you use another service to bypass blocking (for example, a VPN) to increase the connection speed.

privateBrowsingRequired.message: Allow the Extension to Work in Private Windows.

privateBrowsingRequiredDesc.message: So that we can open blocked sites for you through a proxy. In Firefox, there is no way without it.

optionsIgnoredWebsitesDesc.message: Addresses for which the proxy will always be disabled. It can help if there are problems with opening the site.

showNotificationsDesc.message: We will warn you when a site transmits your messages, personal data and all traffic to third parties automatically.

shareFeedback.message: Got issues or suggestions? Let us know!

unavailableOrBlocked.message: The site is unavailable or blocked

proxyDisabledDesc.message: You have disabled site block crawling with Censor Tracker, but $details$ is unavailable. Try opening it through the Censor Tracker?

useProxyDesc.message: If the site is blocked, the Censor Tracker will grant access to it. Disable this setting if you use another service to bypass blocking (for example, a VPN) to increase the connection speed.

controlledByOtherExtensionTitle.message:
Now another extension «
$name$
» is controlling your proxy settings

controlledByOtherExtensionDesc.message:
For normal use of CensorTracker, disable «
$name$
» in browser settings.

controlledByOtherExtensions.message: Other extensions control your proxy settings in browser.

controlledByOtherExtensionsDesc.message: For normal use of CensorTracker, disable the following extensions in browser settings:

proxyUnavailable.message: Unable to open the site through the Censor Tracker proxy.

proxyUnavailableDesc.message: Unable to open the site $URL$. We are working on fixing the problem, please try to open the site later.

siteUnavailableTitle.message: The site is unavailable or blocked in your country

siteUnavailableDesc.message: Unable to open the site $url$. try opening it through the Censor Tracker proxy?

extensionInstalledDesc.message: Pin the extension in browser panel in two clicks to always be aware which sites can transfer your messages, personal data and all traffic to third parties.

cooperationAcceptedMessage.message: $hostname$ may share your data with third parties.

muteNotificationsForThis.message: Do not show for this website

trafficShapingDescription.message: Traffic shaping detected: connection to the site is slowed down. Censor Tracker gives you access to the site at a normal speed.

installedAllowIncognitoDescription.message: This permission is required so that CensorTracker can open blocked sites for you through a proxy. In Firefox, there is no other way.

installedAllowIncognitoDescriptionThen.message: After that, open the popup of CensorTracker and confirm that the permissions are granted.

incognitoAccessRequiredTitle.message: The site is unavailable or blocked. Allow Censor Tracker incognito access to open such sites.

incognitoAccessRequiredDescription.message: To open $hostname$ through a proxy in Firefox, you need permission to work in private windows. Otherwise, the proxy will not work.

optionsUseDPIDetectionDescription.message: When this feature is turned on, the browser redirects all HTTP requests to HTTPS to make blocked websites abort the connection and spit out an error, based on which CensorTracker decides whether to proxy the website or not.

advancedOptionsDesc.message: You can manually update the local database of blocked websites, update the config of CensorTracker and manage other advanced options.
